header.description: This plugin provides steps for deploying applications to AWS Elastic Beanstalk and managing AWS Elastic Beanstalk Applications and Environments.

step-type.name: Application Exists
step-type.description: Check whether the specified Elastic Beanstalk Application already exists.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key.

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Application Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Application Name

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Create Application
step-type.description: Create a new Elastic Beanstalk Application.

property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Application Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Application Name

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: List Stacks
step-type.description: List all of the Solution Stack Names for an Elastic Beanstalk Environment and allow the user to select one from a filtered list.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property
Filter list of stack using keywor
property-ui.label: Stack Filter
Display Results Selection Dialog
property-ui.description: Controls whether the information should be displayed
Column name to be used for selection
property-ui.label: Key column Name for Selection
Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Environment Exists
step-type.description: Check whether the specified Elastic Beanstalk Environment already exists.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Environment Name

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Create Environment
step-type.description: Create a new Elastic Beanstalk Environment.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Application Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Application Name

property-ui.label: Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Environment Name - spaces will be replaced with dashes

property-ui.label: Domain
property-ui.description: First part of environments Domain name (cNAME Prefix)

property-ui.label: Solution Stack Name
property-ui.description: Solution Stack Name for the Environment

property-ui.label: Configuration Option Settings
property-ui.description: Specify a new line separated list of Configuration Options to set in the form of namespace->option->value. Eg: aws:autoscaling:launchconfiguration->InstanceType->t2.medium will set the launched instance type to medium.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

property-ui.label: Environment Name

step-type.name: Restart Environment Application Servers
step-type.description: Restarts Application Servers in an Elastic Beanstalk Environment.

step-type.name: Swap Environment URLs
step-type.description: Swap URLs for two Elastic Beanstalk Environments.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Source Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Source Environment Name

property-ui.label: Target Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Target Environment Name

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Terminate Environment

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Environment Name

property-ui.label: Terminate Resources
property-ui.description: Terminate all the resources in the environment.

property-ui.label: Force Termination
property-ui.description: Force terminate of the environment even if there are dependencies.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Deploy into Elastic Beanstalk
step-type.description: Deploy an Application Version into an Elastic Beanstalk Environment.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Application Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Application Name

property-ui.label: Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Environment Name

property-ui.label: Application Version
property-ui.description: The name of the version to be created.

property-ui.label: Base Directory
property-ui.description: The root directory where version files are stored.

property-ui.label: Version File
property-ui.description: The name of the packaged file, e.g. .zip/.war to be uploaded.

property-ui.label: S3 Bucket Name
property-ui.description: The S3 Bucket to upload to.

property-ui.label: S3 Key Prefix
property-ui.description: Prefix to be applied to the S3 Bucket upload.

property-ui.label: Overwrite Version
property-ui.description: Overwite the version if it already exists. If this option is not selected and a version already exists it will be reused.

property-ui.label: Wait for environment
property-ui.description: Wait for the environment to be READY

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Application Version Exists
step-type.description: Check whether the specified Elastic Beanstalk Application Version already exists.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region

property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Application Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Application Name

property-ui.label: Application Version Name
property-ui.description: The name of the application version to be checked.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Wait for Environment
step-type.description: Wait for an Elastic Beanstalk Environment to transition to the specified Health and Status.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Environment Name

property-ui.label: Environment Status
property-ui.description: The status of the environment.

property-ui.label: Environment Health
property-ui.description: The health of the environment.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Environment Health and Status
step-type.description: Get the Health and Status of an Elastic Beanstalk Environment and set the output properties "envHealth" and "envStatus" accordingly.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Environment Name
property-ui.description: Beanstalk Environment Name

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Generate Unique Environment Name
step-type.description: Generates a valid and unique Elastic Beanstalk Environment name by checking if an environment of same name already exists and set the output property "envName" accordingly.

property-ui.label: Access Key Id
property-ui.description: The EC2 access key id to use to login.

property-ui.label: Secret Key
property-ui.description: The EC2 Secret Key

property-ui.label: Region
property-ui.description: Select the Elastic Beanstalk region that you want to use.

property-ui.label: Default Region
property-ui.description: Elastic Beanstalk default region - overrides Region property

property-ui.label: DA Application Name
property-ui.description: Deployment Automation Application Name

property-ui.label: DA Environment Name
property-ui.description: Deployment Automation Environment Name

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.
